channel.title: Morning Cybersecurity
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Cybersecurity examines the latest news in cybersecurity policy and politics.

item.title: A TikTok firewall — or fig leaf?
item.description: A new TikTok deal promises U.S. data, U.S. oversight — and fewer China ties. But Washington isn’t convinced that it’s enough.
item.dc:creator: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel
item.dc:contributor: By Maggie Miller and Dana Nickel

item.title: AI’s push into health care triggers cyber alarm bells
item.description: Artificial intelligence makers are betting big on the health care sector. But security experts are warning that the rapid adoption of AI in health systems may bring more risk than reward.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Trump’s cyber options in Iran
item.description: A U.S. cyberattack on Iran could offer President Donald Trump a stealthier option against Tehran — but one that comes with escalation risks.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Maduro’s fall puts US cyber power in the spotlight
item.description: The U.S. appears to have used its cyber capabilities to capture Venezuela’s leader over the weekend — revealing how the U.S. could wield cyber power in future geopolitical showdowns.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel and Maggie Miller
item.dc:contributor: By Dana Nickel and Maggie Miller

item.title: Andrew Garbarino’s full cyber plate
item.description: House Homeland Security Chair Andrew Garbarino has a packed cyber agenda next year, which he outlined in an interview with your host.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: As schools power down for the holidays, hackers power up
item.description: With schools nationwide easing into the holidays, hackers may see the lull in activity as a window of opportunity to strike an already-vulnerable sector.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel

item.title: Cyber ins — and outs — of the NDAA
item.description: The compromise text of the National Defense Authorization Act dropped late on Sunday. Your host breaks down some of the key cyber policy elements that made it in — and notable snubs.
item.dc:creator: By Dana Nickel
